case_vignette: A 40-YEAR-OLD FEMALE COMPLAINS ABOUT SQUAMOUS PAPULES ON HER SCALP FOR 10 YEARS. THESE LESIONS RESPONDED TO TOPICAL CORTICOSTEROIDS BUT RECURS WHEN THE TREATMENT IS STOPPED. SHE DENIES ANY SYSTEMIC SYMPTOMS. PHYSICAL EXAM REVEALS ERYTHEMATOUS SCALY PAPULES WITH SIGNS OF ATROPHY AND SCARRING, AS WELL AS CICATRICIAL ALOPECIA. SKIN BIOPSY SHOWS LICHENOID INTERFACE DERMATITIS WITH HYPERKERATOSIS AND FOLLICULAR PLUGGING.
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have small scaly bumps on my scalp that have been there for a long time, and the skin there seems to be thinning with some hair loss.
How old are you and what is your gender?
I am a 40-year-old female.
Have you been diagnosed with any skin or autoimmune diseases in the past?
I have not been diagnosed with any specific systemic symptoms or diseases.
Do these scaly bumps itch, burn, or cause any discomfort?
No, I do not experience any itching, burning, or discomfort from the bumps.
Is there a history of similar skin issues or autoimmune diseases in your family?
I haven't mentioned any family history of similar skin issues or autoimmune diseases.
Have you used any new hair products or treatments before noticing these symptoms?
I haven't mentioned using any new hair products or treatments before noticing these symptoms.
Final Diagnosis: Lichen Planopilaris

Accompanying these bumps, the patient has observed thinning skin and some loss of hair. She has no diagnosed systemic symptoms or diseases and does not experience any itching, burning, or discomfort related to the bumps. No family history of similar skin issues or autoimmune diseases has been recorded, and there have been no recent changes in hair products or treatments preceding the onset of these symptoms.

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have small, scaly patches on my scalp that are red and have caused some hair loss in those areas.
How long have you had these symptoms?
I've had these symptoms for 10 years.
Have you received any treatment for these symptoms in the past? If so, what kind?
Yes, I've used topical corticosteroids which helped improve the symptoms, but they come back when I stop the treatment.
Do you have any similar symptoms on other parts of your body, or is it limited to your scalp?
No, the symptoms are limited to my scalp. I don't have similar symptoms on other parts of my body.
Do any of your family members have similar scalp issues, or any known skin conditions like psoriasis or eczema?
I didn't mention any family history of similar scalp issues or known skin conditions like psoriasis or eczema.
Final Diagnosis: Scalp Psoriasis

The symptoms are confined to the scalp with no similar symptoms on other parts of the body. The patient did not report any family history of similar scalp issues or known skin conditions like psoriasis or eczema.
